title: ASMR: The new social media craze every parent should know about
text:
“Do you know why I pulled you over?” she asks in a husky whisper. “Do you know why I pulled you over?” she repeats, louder this time.

“Fortunately for you, being stupid isn't a crime. Licence, registration and insurance NOW!”

She is wearing knee-high boots, a skimpy police uniform, dangly earrings and is brandishing handcuffs. She is 13.

Makenna Kelly, or ‘MaK’ as she is known on YouTube, is one of the most successful viral stars of the latest ASMR trend - known as ‘ASMRtists’.

The trend for ASMR, (short for Autonomous Sensory Meridian Response), is widely credited with starting in 2009 when the first whisper-focused channel launched on Youtube.

ASMR is a sensation or experience characterised...
description: “Do you know why I pulled you over?
